addressleaf.section:
A M
r
Bodley le 23
me
d'avril 1596

page.lettertext:
fol.260r
To my honorable good freind M
r
Bodlie
Esquire
S
r
I am first to render yow hartie thankes for your
remembr ance & kind greting
sent &
for
delivered unto me
by
S
r
Anthony Standen
then to
present
make
offer
an
[.]
earnest request unto yow in his behalfe which
he himselfe had presented this afternone if my
Lord
of Essex
had not co
m
aunded his attendance in Court.
The matter
His request
S
r
is this
t forasmuch as
e expedition
of my Lordes de
ture to
giveth him no time
whome he is to
attend in
e voyage gives him no leysure or meanes to intend
e recoverie of 200
li
w
ch
as he saith your brother M
r
Hickm
a
knowes
t
he is
assured
to receave 2 monethes hence
t
yow would vouchsafe
t
it would please yow to replie & procure some freind of
youres to furnish & advance him
e said somme upp
o
good assurance wherein if it please yow to gratefie
e
gen
t
e rather at my mediation I shall account it
as a spetiall favour done to my selfe and acknow-
ledge it accordinglie to
e uttermost of my small
power.
And so I wishe yow as my selfe.
Your intire loving freind to use
